results.content: Cours passionnant sur un sujet qui est peu traité. beaucoup de concepts nouveaux pour moi. Aurait mérité d'être plus long, avec des explications plus longues, et des exercices commentés.
results.content_html: Cours passionnant sur un sujet qui est peu traité. beaucoup de concepts nouveaux pour moi. Aurait mérité d'être plus long, avec des explications plus longues, et des exercices commentés.

results.content: extra ordinary..concise and tightly packed tutorial..
Interesting topics presented in a very fast and unfriendly way :( it is a shame.
results.content_html: Interesting topics presented in a very fast and unfriendly way :( it is a shame.

results.content: running through quite a lot of things quickly without proper guidance and explanation. Instructor needs to slow down and think in the student's perspective.
results.content_html: running through quite a lot of things quickly without proper guidance and explanation. Instructor needs to slow down and think in the student's perspective.

results.content: Most of the course is watching the presenter code which is fine if he took time to explain it. The code changes very rapidly and is difficult and some times impossible to follow. To really grasp this material I would have to watch this course multiple times and go to other sources to help me understand.

results.content: Not very suited for people trying to learn something new, unless you are already a javascript wizard. The author walks through code-examples in lightning speed and is nowhere close to being a pedagogically planned course. You might pick up some tips here and there, but if you are looking for a tutorial that explains functional javascript is then this is not the one...
results.content_html: Not very suited for people trying to learn something new, unless you are already a javascript wizard. The author walks through code-examples in lightning speed and is nowhere close to being a pedagogically planned course. You might pick up some tips here and there, but if you are looking for a tutorial that explains functional javascript is then this is not the one...

results.content: The pace that the course is delivered at is way to fast for me to follow. When I sent in some feedback I received a response saying that the author would be notified of my feedback. But that's it. Nothing else happened. I wish I could recommend this course, but it's hasn't helped me understand what it promises enough to justify recommending it to others. I'll gladly eat my words if the course is given at a slower pace with and with more background given before each topic. I probably won't waste my time finishing the course, as it's just confusing me more than helping.

results.content:
Unfortunately, this course is not very helpful and a disappointment. I wanted to learn new concepts on how to write efficient Javascript code, but the way this course is taught makes it very hard to learn anything. 

First, the instructor reads from a script. While this is not per se wrong, in this case the language used is stale and unnecessarily complex, uses too many 'big words' without properly explaining them and is delivered without much engagement. 

I am writing Javascript code since over two years now and I know that I still have to learn much in that area, but this course nearly from the start was over my head. The course starts too fast and leaves its students behind. Each section starts too fast and doesn't explain the "problem" it is trying to solve and leaves the listener guessing what concept the solution actually is trying to demonstrate.

The fact that there are way over 100 students enrolled in this course and not a single question has been asked makes me wonder how many students are really 'engaged' in this course.

I have bought this course because I was very interested in the topic of functional programming. I should have looked at the rating and the reviews first - all negative....
